feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Fiori
feed.subtitle: SAP Fiori Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: What end-to-end testing tools are best for SAP BTP (BAS) applications with CDS views and SAPUI5?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am working on SAP Business Application Studio (BAS) projects deployed on SAP BTP that use CDS views as the data model and SAPUI5 for the front end.

I would like to implement end-to-end testing for these applications. I am familiar with general-purpose tools like Playwright or WebdriverIO, but I am not sure if they are the best fit when testing applications in the SAP ecosystem (especially those with CDS/OData services and SAPUI5).

  • Has anyone successfully used Playwright or WebdriverIO for BAS/SAPUI5 projects?

  • Are there recommended frameworks or libraries specifically designed for UI5 applications?

  • What are the best practices for handling such tests?

  • Any tutorials, examples, or community resources you could share?

Thanks in advance for your insights!

entry.title: Decision Step In Workflow screen not showing
entry.content:
I have workflow items configured to show in Fiori My inbox app. User selects one item ie a display a financial document and clicks on Open Task button and it navigates to FBO3 TCode in webgui in browser for user to review document.

Once reviewd and okayed, The user clicks on back button in Tcode  SAP webgui screen but instead of opening expected gray colored webgui decision screen with Approve/Reject/exit button ( PFA screenshot ), it opens blank webgui screen with Close Window button ie navigating to the screen that is supposed to open in end once item is processed.

i have checked in PFTC, pls let me know other settings or what to check in pftc? Help !

entry.title: How to create ODATA v4 POST API where it will take input as a structure and send back array of data
entry.content:
Dear Community,                                                                                                                                                                          I have a requirement where I want take a structure of fields as input and respond back with different structure or array of another structure/data. And this I want to create using ODATA v4 with latest ABAP. 

Can someone help me by providing some working sample piece of code and steps which needs to be followed?

I appreciate your response in advance.

Regards,                                                                                                                                                                             Omkar

entry.title: Is this App 'Create Sales Orders - Automatic Extraction App ID: F4920' Instruction file
entry.content:
Hi,

We are evaluating the FIORI App on S/4HANA on-premise  'Create Sales Orders - Automatic Extraction App ID: F4920'. We need the instructions to setup the communication scenarios for S/4HANA on-premise.

While extracting data from uploaded file, we get error 'Contact your system admin to set up the required communication scenario' 

 

On the SAP Application help Create Sales Orders - Automatic Extraction | SAP Help Portal page , under prerequisite it shows a path to open Create Sales Orders from Unstructured Data (‏4X9‏). 

 

But this takes us to only Solution scenarios for cloud. on which the instructions file cant be downloaded. Process Navigator - SAP for Me 

 

Can anyone provide the instructions to setup the communication scenarios for S/4HANA on-premise.

 

Thanks,

Neha

entry.title: SAP BAS Adaptation Project Layout editor plugin not installed error
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am getting below error, when I am trying to create an extension project using SAP Adaptation Project template.

The Extensibility Project generator plugin was not found in your dev space and it is required for this action. To proceed, please install the <SAPUI5 Layout Editor & Extensibility> extension.

My Fiori Dev space contains SAPUI5 Layout Editor & Extensibility as a predefined one, but still getting above error.

entry.title: how to avoid the unnecessary js calls in the sap fiori custom application
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

Recently i have created a custom fiori application using just smart filter bar and smart table. But when i try to run the application its calling so many js files in network calls and because of that its taking time load the application. 

We already have component.preload.js file for our application which is added automatically after creating project in BAS.

Please suggest how can i avoid the below calls.

KR,

Anji

entry.title: "Deploying Fiori apps in BAS: Object name syntax error in ABAP Deploy"
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I’m currently working on deploying a Fiori component from SAP Business Application Studio (BAS) to an ABAP backend system using the "npm run deploy" command. However, I’m encountering a persistent deployment error that’s blocking progress.

error abap-deploy-task Z_SGM_RRB This syntax cannot be used for an object name

I noticed the deployment log mentions issues with .xlsx files not being recognized, so I have created ". Ui5RepositoryBinaryFiles". After including the file there is no error with excel files and they being recognized.

Has anyone faced this issue before? How can I fix the problem, so the deployment succeeds?

Thanks in advance for any help!

entry.title: How to add a custom button to the RichTextEditor Toolbar?
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am very new to Fiori Development and need some help.  I am implementing a Fiori App utilizing the Rich Text Editor.  The application is based on a CDS Data Model to generate a List-Detail experience.  On the Detail Page, a custom section was used to provide the user with the Rich Text Editor to provide formatting, such as Bold, Italic, etc. text which would be saved to a string in the table.  This works perfectly for the text editing.  Now, some custom buttons are required for additional functionality.   However, I have been struggling to add custom buttons to the toolbar.

The fragment definition for the custom section is below.

<core:FragmentDefinition
  xmlns:core="sap.ui.core"
  xmlns="sap.m"
  xmlns:rte="sap.ui.richtexteditor"
>

  <rte:RichTextEditor
    id="_IDGenRichTextEditor"
    value="{LongText}"
    height="300px"
    width="100%"
    required="false"
    editable="true"
    editorType="TinyMCE7" 
    showGroupClipboard="true" 
    showGroupFont="true"
    showGroupInsert="true"
    showGroupLink="true"
    showGroupTextAlign ="true"
  >
  </rte:RichTextEditor>     
</core:FragmentDefinition>

At first, I thought I could set the property for the custom toolbar and add the button in the fragment definition.  This is similar to some of the sample code I found from the documentation.  However, this has not been working for me.  Below is a sample of what I attempted.  

   customToolbar="true" 
    customButtons="{
      path: '/customButtons',
      template: 'sap.m.Button'
    }"
          <richtexteditor:customButtons>
            <Button
                id="myCustomButton"
                text="My Custom Button"
                press=".onMyCustomButtonPress"
            />
        </richtexteditor:customButtons>

 When this did not work, I thought that it would be best to add a Controller Extension to the Object Page.  I tried to model from a solution I found here. Below is a rough idea of what I attempted in the onInit function.  Unfortunately, this did not work for me either.

 var oRichTextEditor = this.getView().byId("_IDGenRichTextEditor");

            var oButton = new sap.m.Button("button", {
						text: "My Button",
						icon: "sap-icon://eraser",
						press: this.onPress.bind(this)
					});

            oRichTextEditor.addCustomButton(oButton);
			sap.ui.getCore().applyChanges();

Can anyone highlight what am I doing wrong?  Is my approach with the Fragment or the Controller Extension wrong?  I would appreciate it if anyone can shed some light on this for me.  Thanks in advance for your help.

John

entry.title: How to consume OData service in Fiori app using approuter and destination in Cloud Foundry (404 Not
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I am developing a CAP project on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry. I want to consume an OData V4 service from a Fiori (UI5) application using approuter and a destination.

- Backend (CAP, OData V4):
https://<subdomain>-back.cfapps.<region>.hana.ondemand.com/odata/v4/invitacion/ReadProveedor

- Frontend (Fiori + approuter):
https://<subdomain>-frontend.cfapps.<region>.hana.ondemand.com/frontfront/index.html

### Approuter (xs-app.json)
```json
{
"welcomeFile": "/frontfront/index.html",
"routes": [
{
"source": "^/backend/(.*)$",
"target": "/$1",
"destination": "SRV_BACKEND",
"authenticationType": "xsuaa"
}
]
}

 

 

Destination in BTP cockpit

  • Name: SRV_BACKEND
  • URL: https://-back.cfapps..hana.ondemand.com
  • ProxyType: Internet
  • Authentication: OAuth2JWTBearer

 

Frontend manifest.json

"dataSources": {
"backend_odata": {
"uri": "/backend/odata/v4/invitacion/",
"type": "OData",
"settings": { "odataVersion": "4.0" }
}
}

 

Problem

When the app tries to load metadata (/backend/odata/v4/invitacion/$metadata), I receive 404 Not Found.

Accessing the backend service directly via its URL works fine.

What I tried

  • Verified that the destination exists in BTP cockpit and points to the backend URL.
  • Checked the backend service directly (responds correctly).
  • Reviewed approuter logs — I see messages like “Missing internal url for request …”.

What configuration should I adjust in the approuter or the destination so that the frontend Fiori app can correctly consume the OData service via /backend/...?

Any guidance or working examples would be greatly appreciated

entry.title: Print to local Printer from Fiori
entry.content:
Hello

We are migrating from SAP ECC 6 to S/4 HANA and we are switching from SAPGUI to 100% Fiori.

We noticed that when users send to print from Fiori, it does not recognize the Local Printer that users have as default in Windows., when they send from SAP GUI it does recognize the local printer, but not from Fiori

Does anyone has had this issue and could solve it ?

Thanks a lot

Sergio

entry.title: smart filter bar not visible after smart table personalisation in SAP Fiori custom app.
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We have developed a custom Fiori application using Smart Filter bar and Smart table. 

When we create a custom variant using personalization and set the variant as default the smart filter bar is not visible this happens after we logoff and login again. 

 

We are not seeing any issue if we set the variant as standard. We haven't done any customization in the coding as we just mapped entityset and kept "useperonization=true".

 

KR,

Anji

entry.title: FIORI APP extensibility
entry.content:
I need to extend a standard Fiori application with a custom field. Normally, the recommended approach would be to use the Custom Fields and Logic app, which automatically creates a new field (with the ZZ1_ prefix) in the relevant table and exposes it to Fiori.

However, in my case, the situation is different:

The customer has already added a custom field ZCLASS in table MARD using an append structure and this field is already in use across multiple forms, reports (so it’s business critical)

If I use the Custom Fields and Logic app now, it will create a new field ZZ1_CLASS in MARD, which would lead to redundant fields for the same purpose.

My question is what is the correct approach to resolve this issue?

Thank you In advance

entry.title: Cancel Billing Document (VF11) – Billing Document field always resets to previous
entry.content:
When using the Fiori app Cancel Billing Document (VF11), the Billing Document input field always reverts to the previously cancelled document:

I cancel a billing document, and the number remains in the VF11 screen. When I try to enter another billing document, the field is cleared and the previous number reappears

I checked my user parameters and looked for any application variants, but did not find any.

entry.title: Change the application title on the detail page of Perform Maintenance Jobs
entry.content:
Through an adaptation project, we've made some changes to the Perform Maintenance Jobs app (F5104A). We gave the adaptation the title "<company> Perform Maintenance Jobs". Now this is what shows up at the top of the page next to our logo. This is good.

But when the user clicks on one of the maintenance jobs in the list, it goes to a page with application title "Perform Maintenance Job". We'd like to change that so it says "<company> Perform Maintenance Job". How would we do that?

I've tried going back to the adaptation project, but there's nothing there to set that detail page title -- as far as I can tell anyway.

I think it may have to do with the technical and business catalogs. There's two entries for F5104A, one for the Maintenance Job, and one for the Maintenance Notification, and their titles match the two we see in the original app. I've tried copying the second one to my TC, and changing the title there, and have the BC reflect this also, but that didn't work. Somehow, I would have to tell our adapted tile to use the adapted target mapping for the Notification.

entry.content:

I have already researched through various sources (Google, SAP Notes...), but I could not find a solution.
Could anyone who has experience in this area suggest or guide me on how to configure or implement this requirement?

Thank you in advance for your support.

entry.title: Multiple Table views in Fiori App via RAP not working
entry.content:
I tried to get Multiple Table Views via RAP, in an OData V4 Fiori App, but it is not working.

In the metadata annotation I added the following in bold: 

@ui: { headerInfo: { title:{ value: 'MissionNeedsNumber' }, typeName: 'Product List', typeNamePlural: 'Product Lists', description:{ value: 'MissionName' } },

presentationVariant: [{ sortOrder: [{ by: 'MissionNeedsNumber', direction: #DESC }], visualizations: [{type: #AS_LINEITEM}] } ],

selectionVariant: [ {

text: 'completed (2 Ranges)',

qualifier: 'Completed'

},

{

text: 'In Process',

qualifier: 'InProcess'

} ] }

@ui.createHidden: #(hide_create)

annotate view zc_mn_missionneeds with

 

Source: https://github.com/SAP-samples/fiori-elements-feature-showcase/blob/main/README.md#general-features

In the metadata xml in can see it is getting loaded when opening the App. See bold part.

 

</Annotation>
<Annotation Term="SAP__UI.SelectionVariant" Qualifier="InProcess">
<Record>
<PropertyValue Property="Text" String="In Process"/>
</Record>
</Annotation>
<Annotation Term="SAP__UI.SelectionVariant" Qualifier="Completed">
<Record>
<PropertyValue Property="Text" String="completed (2 Ranges)"/>
</Record>
</Annotation>
<Annotation Term="Communication.Contact">

 

 Still, there are no text tabs on the List screen.

 

What am I doing wrong? Of course I don't do an actual selection yet, but I at least expected the text tabs to be present on the App list screen.
